io.github.pr0methean.betterrandom.util

Class LooperThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • io.github.pr0methean.betterrandom.util.LooperThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RandomSeederThread

    public class LooperThread
extends Thread
    Thread that loops a given task until interrupted (or until JVM shutdown, if it is a daemon thread), with the iterations being transactional.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        Thread.State, Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Condition endOfIteration 
      protected AtomicLong finishedIterations 
      protected Lock lock
      The thread holds this lock whenever it is being serialized or cloned or is running iterate() called by run().
      protected Runnable target
      The Runnable that was passed into this thread's constructor, if any.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LooperThread

        public LooperThread(@Nullable
                    Runnable target,
                    String name)
        Constructs a LooperThread with the given name and target. target should only be null if called from a subclass that overrides iterate().
        Parameters:
        target - If not null, the target this thread will run in iterate().
        name - the thread name

      • LooperThread

        public LooperThread(ThreadGroup group,
                    @Nullable
                    Runnable target)
        Constructs a LooperThread that belongs to the given ThreadGroup and has the given target. target should only be null if called from a subclass that overrides iterate().
        Parameters:
        group - The ThreadGroup this thread will belong to.
        target - If not null, the target this thread will run in iterate().

      • LooperThread

        public LooperThread(ThreadGroup group,
                    @Nullable
                    Runnable target,
                    String name,
                    long stackSize)

        Constructs a LooperThread with the given name and target, belonging to the given ThreadGroup and having the given preferred stack size. target should only be null if called from a subclass that overrides iterate().

        See Thread.Thread(ThreadGroup, Runnable, String, long) for caveats about specifying the stack size.

        Parameters:
        group - The ThreadGroup this thread will belong to.
        target - If not null, the target this thread will run in iterate().
        name - the thread name
        stackSize - the desired stack size for the new thread, or zero to indicate that this parameter is to be ignored.

      • LooperThread

        protected LooperThread(ThreadGroup group,
                       String name)
        Constructs a LooperThread with the given name and belonging to the given ThreadGroup. Protected because it does not set a target, and thus should only be used in subclasses that override iterate().
        Parameters:
        group - The ThreadGroup this thread will belong to.
        name - the thread name

      • LooperThread

        public LooperThread(@Nullable
                    Runnable target)
        Constructs a LooperThread with the given target. target should only be null if called from a subclass that overrides iterate().
        Parameters:
        target - If not null, the target this thread will run in iterate().

      • LooperThread

        public LooperThread(ThreadGroup group,

                    String name)
        Constructs a LooperThread with the given name and target, belonging to the given ThreadGroup. target should only be null if called from a subclass that overrides iterate().

        Parameters:

      • LooperThread

        protected LooperThread()
        Constructs a LooperThread with all properties as defaults. Protected because it does not set a target, and thus should only be used in subclasses that override iterate().

    • Method Detail

      • iterate

        protected boolean iterate()
                   throws InterruptedException
        The task that will be iterated until it returns false. Cannot be abstract for serialization reasons, but must be overridden in subclasses if they are instantiated without a target Runnable.
        Returns:
        true if this thread should iterate again.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if interrupted in mid-execution.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this method has not been overridden and target was not set to non-null during construction.

      • run

        public final void run()
        Runs iterate() until either it returns false or this thread is interrupted.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread

      • awaitIteration

        public boolean awaitIteration(long time,
                              TimeUnit unit)
                       throws InterruptedException
        Wait for the next iteration to finish, with a timeout. May wait longer in the event of a spurious wakeup.
        Parameters:
        time - the maximum time to wait
        unit - the time unit of the time argument
        Returns:
        false the waiting time detectably elapsed before an iteration finished, else true
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if thrown by Condition.await(long, TimeUnit)
